newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU grain export commitments exceed 26.7 mln tonnes.
newsitem.headline: EU grain export commitments exceed 26.7 mln tonnes.

text.p: European Union grain export commitments up to May 20 rose 63 percent over last year, official figures showed on Friday.

Figures supplied by member country officials showed grain earmarked for export between July 1, 1996 and May 20, 1997 totalled 26.715 million tonnes against 16.408 million during the same period last year.
Exports of commercial soft wheat grain reached 9.787 million tonnes against 5.653 million a year ago. Soft wheat flour exports jumped to 5.769 million tonnes from 3.785 million.
Barley exports reached 6.159 million tonnes against 1.563 million tonnes.
On Thursday the European Union granted the export of 21,450 tonnes of barley.
The EU has closed the weekly tender for wheat exports and imposed a tax of 15 Ecus per tonne on daily soft wheat exports and of 20 Ecus on soft wheat flour exports.
The move is aimed at keeping domestic prices and supplies under control in the face of volatile prices.
